Message.Title: Variety: Emmys, Yahoo in Exclusive Content Deal
Message.Msg: More great breaking news for Yahoo! But this news story needs one correction: Yahoo now has over 1 Billion users. (More people watched the Olympics on Yahoo than on any television network). "The TV Academy has inked a one-year deal to make Yahoo its official digital partner for red carpet, backstage and behind-the-scenes coverage surrounding — but not limited to — this year’s Emmys." "Yahoo, which boasts 700 million users worldwide, is the first digital partner for the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences that is not affiliated with a broadcaster."

Message.Title: Vimeo valuation.
Message.Msg: Was doing some research on Vimeo. Last year, Diller was pushing for it to be valued at $300 million but those in the know felt it was too high. At that time they had around 60 million uniques & under $ 5 million in revenue. Any one have updated info? I've always liked Vimeo aesthetically, but they do not have much of a business model, I see they have their pro & plus plans. I think most Vimeo users preferred it to Youtube for its aesthetic & lack of ads. Not too worried about users going elsewhere should Yahoo acquire - where would they go? I didn't know that Vimeo was created by founders of College Humor. I love that site.

Message.Title: Attention
Message.Msg: Yhoo is behaving just like past quarter. If this behavior remains, then this week, will oscillate between $24-$25. Ending the week strong at high $25/low $26. Next week will do the same, but between $26-$27. On monday before earnings, it will crash to high $25. And after release we will see. I hope to see a pop of 5%, but you never know....

This is my analysis. Q1-FY13 -- Display=$402M, Search=$409, Other=$264. . My forecast with current Data: FY13 -- Display=$406.02 (assuming same FY12 YoY growth + new Sales model leveling) + Search=$433.66M (assuming YoY CPC growth + Growth of total searches per comscore) + Other=$287.10M (10% growth as past Q). . Total REV= $1,127M. Estimates=$1,100. My estimate is 2.43% higher.

Message.Msg: There are 2 things I review, when I look at NGB stock. One. I have been to Greece, and I did experience, first hand, a Bank strike. They simply had the doors open, but Not one person would service your account, nor your currency exchange. They said to me: "Excuse me, but we are on strike." OK, and I did understand. But why did they have the doors open, and to the several banks I passed by, and chose toi walk into.? Travel is the highest level of education that one can ever achieve. Let's roll
